title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [15 july 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15 July 1868]
text: 15 July 1868wensdayWednesday ten oclocko'clockWell Walter deari write again to let you know we are all in the land of the living had a pretty hard squeesesqueeze to worry through but we have got along so far all pretty well considering this awful weather we have had) these rooms is quite cool if there is any air at all but mondayMonday night we had to keep shut up all the front part of the house on sundaySunday there was one of the car horses died and he laid just acrostacross the street and he laid there till tuesdayTuesday and the whole neighborhood was distressed with the smell the horses droptdropped from the cars in several other routsroutes well waltWalt i got the letter tuesdayTuesday this week it dontdon't make any very material difference only i get figgetyfidgety for fear itsit's stolen there dontdon't seem to be quite so much complaintcomplaint of loosinglosing letters as there was at one time) i hope you will keep well walterWalter you are very carefullcareful i know i think itsit's so nessarynecessary to be i wish georgeGeorge was half as carefullcareful they haventhaven't done much on the main till to day they have been raising the stone from where the old tunnel was filled up so they haventhaven't laid much pipe till to day so it was well for georgeGeorge as it wouldentwouldn't take much to get him to feel the effects of the heatgeorgesGeorge's house is raised was raised last saturdaySaturday three story and cellar with stone under smithSmith is in a hurry to get it done as he is going to oversee frenchesFrench's buildings) i seldom hear from the st louLou isSt. Louis folks they are very slow to write i wrote a letter to mattyMatty telling her i just wrote to let her know mamma lived in brooklynBrooklyn yet i think mattiMatty might write oftener as for han i dontdon't know as i shall ever hear from her it seems so strange if they was old and lame like me i shouldentshouldn't think so strange well i suppose they all have enoughfenough to doodo) o walterWalter the nomanationnomination aintain't it great i wish you could see the eagle it is worse than ever all the respectable radicals is in favor of seymoreSeymour the eagle says they are nearly all copperheads around here but they are kinlykindly put aback if chaseChase had only been the one they would have carried everything before them good bie walterWalter dear take care of yourself and i will try to doodo the same i am pretty wellL Whitman Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15 July 1868]
